Troubleshooting

Common issues and solutions when using LPM

Troubleshooting Guide

This guide helps you resolve common issues when using LPM.

Common Issues

Installation Issues

Plugin Installation Fails

Problem: lpm install --vm=myvm fails with error

Possible Causes & Solutions:

  1. Network connectivity issues

  2. Insufficient disk space

  3. Invalid plugin definition

SHA256 Checksum Mismatch

Problem: Downloaded binary checksum doesn't match expected value

Solution:

Repository Issues

Cannot Add Private Repository

Problem: Adding private repository fails with authentication error

Solution:

Repository Update Fails

Problem: lpm update fails with git error

Solutions:

Node Communication Issues

Cannot Connect to Admin API

Problem: LPM cannot communicate with Lux node

Diagnostic Steps:

Admin API Authentication Required

Problem: Admin API requires authentication token

Solution:

Subnet Issues

Cannot Join Subnet

Problem: lpm join-subnet fails

Common Causes:

  1. Node not synced: Wait for node to finish bootstrapping
  2. Invalid subnet ID: Verify subnet exists on network
  3. Missing validator: Node must be validator to join subnet
  4. VM not installed: Install required VMs first

Debug Process:

Permission Issues

Cannot Write to Plugin Directory

Problem: Permission denied when installing plugins

Solutions:

Lock File Issues

Problem: "Another instance of lpm is running"

Solution:

Debugging Tips

Enable Verbose Logging

Verify File Integrity

Common Error Codes

CodeMeaningResolution
1General errorCheck logs for details
2Configuration errorVerify config file syntax
3Repository errorCheck repository access
4Network errorVerify network connectivity
5Permission errorCheck file permissions
6State file errorReset state with --force
7Plugin not foundVerify plugin name
8Checksum mismatchClear cache and retry
9Node communication errorCheck node is running
10Subnet errorVerify subnet configuration

Getting Help

Log Files

LPM logs are written to stderr by default. Capture for analysis:

Community Support

  • GitHub Issues: github.com/luxfi/lpm/issues
  • Discord: Lux Discord
  • Documentation: docs.lux.network

Reporting Bugs

When reporting issues, include:

  1. LPM version: lpm --version
  2. Node version: luxd --version
  3. Operating system: uname -a
  4. Full error output with debug logging
  5. State file contents: ~/.lpm/state.yaml
  6. Steps to reproduce

Emergency Recovery

If LPM state becomes corrupted:

FAQ

Q: Can I use LPM without a running node? A: Yes, for repository management and downloading plugins. Node is only required for loadVMs operation.

Q: How do I update all plugins at once? A: Use lpm upgrade to update all installed plugins to latest versions.

Q: Can I install plugins from local directory? A: Yes, use file:// URL when adding repository: lpm add-repository --url=file:///path/to/repo

Q: How do I verify plugin compatibility? A: Check plugin's minVersion and maxVersion in its definition against your node version.

Q: Can I rollback a plugin update? A: Yes, install specific version: lpm install --vm=myvm@v1.2.3

Q: How do I clean up old plugin versions? A: Currently manual removal is required: rm $PLUGIN_PATH/myvm.bak

Q: Can multiple nodes share the same plugin directory? A: Not recommended. Each node should have its own plugin directory to avoid conflicts.
